subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Lexical sets and QS letters
msgSnippet: ... It also happens before m , as in hem sounding like him .  But it is definitely not a full KIT/DRESS merger: I don t think any accent has such a thing.
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn scripsit:

> I think the "pen" "pin" issue is not a total KIT DRESS merger but just
> something that happens before "n". Such people will hear "pen" with
> the KIT sound and thus use #26 I've omitted it from the upload until
> we get a clearer idea.

It also happens before "m", as in "hem" sounding like "him". But it
is definitely not a full KIT/DRESS merger: I don't think any accent
has such a thing.

--
But you, Wormtongue, you have done what you could for your true master. Some
reward you have earned at least. Yet Saruman is apt to overlook his bargains.
I should advise you to go quickly and remind him, lest he forget your faithful
service. --Gandalf John Cowan <cowan@...>

Anthony Grahn scripsit:

> I think the "pen" "pin" issue is not a total KIT DRESS merger but just
> something that happens before "n". Such people will hear "pen" with
> the KIT sound and thus use #26 I've omitted it from the upload until
> we get a clearer idea.

It also happens before "m", as in "hem" sounding like "him".  But it
is definitely not a full KIT/DRESS merger: I don't think any accent
has such a thing.

-- 
But you, Wormtongue, you have done what you could for your true master.  Some
reward you have earned at least.  Yet Saruman is apt to overlook his bargains.
I should advise you to go quickly and remind him, lest he forget your faithful
service.  --Gandalf             John Cowan <cowan@...>
